result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joellen M Copley

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 11:06am 
Defendant Joellen M Copley in court.  Attorney Preston Smead appears by Zoom video.  ADA Michael Witt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds the video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Smead reports that he has been discussing the case with the assigned prosecutor, and that Ms. Copley has actively been engaged in treatment for the past several months. Attorney Smead did provide treatment records to the prosecutor and those are under review. Attorney Smead hopes to further negotiate the matter now that treatment information has been provided. 
recess 11:01am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on December 5th at 9:00am

Pre-trial conference on October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 9:37am 
Defendant Joellen M Copley in court with Attorney Preston Smead.  ADA  Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Smead requests the scheduling of another pretrial conference; it appears the parties are working toward settlement. 
recess 8:56am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on October 12th at 8:30am,  (2) Status Conference on November 1st at 11:00am

Pre-trial conference on August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:37am 
Defendant Joellen M Copley in court with Attorney Preston James Smead.   Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Ms Copley waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 8:40am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/31/22 at 11:00am    (2) Status Conference on 9/23/22 at 9:30am

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 9:32 AM 
Defendant Joellen M Copley in court with Attorney Preston James Smead.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

Scheduling is discussed
recess: 9:34am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/8/22 at 11:00am   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 7/15/22 at 8:30am

--no possession or consumption of alcohol

[ma] Case called at 1:17 PM 
Defendant Joellen M Copley appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth, updates address to: 1205 Mendota St, Madison, 53714
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the chargesand maximum penalties are recited.
Right to Counsel given; Ms. Copley indicates that she intends to hire private counsel

The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits.

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take prescription medications only as prescribed

recess 1:23  pm. 

NEXT: Status of Counsel on 5/6/22 at 9:30am (address prelim time limits)
